intro: Onosma moussavi, commonly known as Persian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in dense spikes, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Onosma moussavi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
